description:
The Natural Colour RGB (Red, Green, Blue) makes use of three solar
          channels: NIR1.6, VIS0.8 and VIS0.6. In this colour scheme vegetation appears greenish
          because of its large reflectance in the VIS0.8 channel (the green beam) compared to the
          NIR1.6 (red beam) and VIS0.6 (blue beam) channels. Water clouds with small droplets have
          large reflectance at all three channels and hence appear whitish, while snow and ice
          clouds appears cyan because ice strongly absorbs in NIR1.6 (no red). Bare ground appears
          brown because of the larger reflectance in the NIR1.6 than at VIS0.6, and the ocean
          appears black because of the low reflectance in all three channels.
title: Natural Colour RGB - MSG - 0 degree

providers.name: European Organisation for the Exploitation of Meteorological Satellites (EUMETSAT)
